title: How long will it take to learn Urdu? - Quora

response.answer_text: It all depends on how much time you can spare daily and wether you want only spoken Urdu or the written language. Spoken Urdu is pretty easy to catch up. Maybe 2 to 3 months. There are a couple of online tutorials which help you learn on the go.  For writing Urdu, Karnataka Urdu Academy located next to town hall in Bangalore conducts regular free classes for working class people. You can check with them atwww.karnatakaurduacademy.org

To read and write I did'nt find it too hard..because I have a Hindi speaking background...I was 13 when I started learning Urdu by a private tutor..It was an hour class everyday...He use to teach 20 min Urdu and rest of time Arabic..it took me about 5 months to get fluent in reading and writing..Speaking part here it goes tough..The vocabulary of Urdu language consist of Arabic and Persian words mix with devnagiri..if someone know any of these language then its somewhat easy to understand and speak otherwise its tough to get it right,One needs to have an environment of Urdu speaking people..
